metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue for Adrielle, one of the hag support group players can meet in the Lower city. The hag support group is made up of people who have survived an encouter with a hag, and who have banded together to try to research hags, but also to be there for one another. However, one of their group (the dragonborn), is secretly a redcap and is toying with their minds. The redcap has also, if Mayrina is present, hexed her and turned her into a sheep. If Mayrina isn't present, the redcap has enchanted a doll that is terrifying the group.This dialogue covers a number of states such as 1) Mayrina is present and has been hexed 2) player cured her 3) player has saved Adrielle and the others from a redcap 4) the hag is dead and Adrielle rewards them (if no other npc is present) 5) if mayrina isn't present, a doll is terrorising them and she's trying to find it

10.speaker: Adrielle
10.text: You're here! Mayrina was looking for you - she says it's urgent.

14.speaker: Adrielle
14.text: I'm an imbecile - the doll showed up days after the dragonborn joined us. Why didn't I see it?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Hag, and their agents, are talented liars.

74.speaker: Adrielle
74.text: I fell for a hag's lies once, and in my arrogance was sure it would never happen again.

67.speaker: Adrielle
67.text: Blast it all - this is because of the book. I brought this on us all.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Tell me - maybe I can help.

54.speaker: Adrielle
54.text: I was researching hags - and came upon their darkest secret.

98.speaker: Adrielle
98.text: A way to burn their bones to ash - and ensure they never return. No tricks, no come-backs - only the cold permanence of death.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Tell me what it is, and I'll deal with the hag - don't worry.

2.speaker: Adrielle
2.text: Thank you - the redcap proved that I'm no match for a hag. Much to my shame.

95.speaker: Adrielle
95.text: There's a safe in the back - within is years worth of research. Kill her before she sends more of her monsters - I beg of you.
95.context: NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

62.speaker: Player
62.text: This is your problem, not mine.

57.speaker: Adrielle
57.text: Wait! My research has painted a target on my back - and the redcap proved I am no match for a hag.

66.speaker: Adrielle
66.text: There's a safe in the back with my life's work. I cannot bear to destroy it, but so long as it exists, I will be hunted. Take it - I beg of you.
66.context: NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I am not getting mixed up in this.

19.speaker: Adrielle
19.text: This attack is proof. Auntie Ethel knows we've discovered her darkest secret, a way to send her to death's cold embrace - for all eternity.

83.speaker: Adrielle
83.text: I spent a lifetime researching these vile creatures - but to my shame I'm no match for Ethel.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Join me - I'll need all the help I can get.

42.speaker: Adrielle
42.text: I can't. If the dragonborn has shown me anything, it's that I'm not ready to face a hag - much to my shame.

63.speaker: Adrielle
63.text: There's a safe in the back - within is everything I know about hags and their abominations.

35.speaker: Adrielle
35.text: Kill Ethel before she seeks vengeance for her fallen redcap. Save us - I beg of you.
35.context: NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

16.speaker: Player
16.text: So get out there and kill her. Don't sit here like cowards.

50.speaker: Adrielle
50.text: A doll was nearly our undoing - we have no chance against her, as much as it pains me to admit it.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: He mentioned a book - mean anything to you?

79.speaker: Adrielle
79.text: Yes. I am... painfully aware. But some good has come of this.

37.speaker: Adrielle
37.text: I'm glad you're here. I clearly lack the power to keep the hag, and her hexes, away from Mayrina.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Have you seen a doll around here?

75.speaker: Adrielle
75.text: A doll? Hm. I saw a curious looking toy in some boxes upstairs, but I figured it the remnants of the previous tenants.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: You protected Mayrina until now - that's worth something.

24.speaker: Adrielle
24.text: You are kind, but I serve Helm - and failing to keep this hex from Mayrina is unforgivable in both his eyes and mine.
24.context: NodeContext: small smile at the player's kindness. but in her mind, everything is still  her fault

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I know Mayrina is hexed, but why a sheep?

82.speaker: Adrielle
82.text: Because to a hag, we are but lambs to her slaughter. We are mere toys - to be used and broken.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Any idea how to remove the hex?

64.speaker: Adrielle
64.text: None. The magic originates from a hag's twisted lair - of that I am sure. But as to its cure, Helm has not revealed it to me.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: You should leave while you still can.

91.speaker: Adrielle
91.text: I was lost when Mayrina and I first met. Yet her courage reminded me of who I am - Helm's shield. I will not turn my back on her.
91.context: NodeContext: fiercely determined to help her friend

40.speaker: Adrielle
40.text: This is all my fault. Mayrina was hexed mere days after the dragonborn joined us. Why didn't I see it?

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Hag, and their agents, are liars and cheats by nature.

55.speaker: Adrielle
55.text: That's no excuse - I know what they're like, yet still I welcomed the dragonborn with open arms.
55.context: NodeContext: angry with herself - wishes she was 'better'

53.speaker: Player
53.text: You're lucky I was here to save your asses.

81.speaker: Adrielle
81.text: Mayrina was right about you. Thank you - for saving her when I couldn't.
81.context: NodeContext: sincere but also continuing to beat herself up for not being 'good enough'

0.speaker: Player
0.text: More than stupid - moronic. You endangered everyone.

32.speaker: Adrielle
32.text: I won't make the same mistake again - I swear it.

44.speaker: Adrielle
44.text: Should you ever have need of a cleric of Helm, I shall be there - you have my word.

48.speaker: Adrielle
48.text: Now is not the time for idle chatter - we need to find the doll!

88.speaker: Adrielle
88.text: We tried - the wretched thing followed us. We have no choice - we must find and destroy it. Before it consumes us all.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I need info - where have you seen the doll?

26.speaker: Adrielle
26.text: Everywhere - inside boxes, under chairs. It could be anywhere.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: What did you do to piss of a hag?

49.speaker: Adrielle
49.text: There's so much blood. Mayrina! Check on Mayrina upstairs!
49.context: NodeContext: shock at the dead redcap, trying to gain conftrol of the situation. Directing the player upstairs.

59.speaker: Adrielle
59.text: I'm an imbecile - Mayrina was hexed mere days after the dragonborn appeared.

99.speaker: Adrielle
99.text: And now she's dead. Why didn't I see it? Why didn't I stop him? Damn it - damn it all!

68.speaker: Adrielle
68.text: The city feels different - like evil's embrace has lessened its vice.

61.speaker: Adrielle
61.text: The hag is dead, isn't she?

20.speaker: Adrielle
20.text: The city is still under threat, and the future is uncertain - but this is a victory for all that is good and kind.

36.speaker: Adrielle
36.text: My only regret is that Mayrina did not live to see this. But she want me to set aside my sorrow - and would also yell at me for 'ruining the mood'.

6.speaker: Adrielle
6.text: Never in my wildest dreams could I have bested the hag - thank you, my friend, for doing the impossible.

46.speaker: Adrielle
46.text: Helm is known as the Vigiliant One for good reason - while I could not see the hag, I could sense her. Now I feel roses where once there were thorns.

71.speaker: Adrielle
71.text: The hag could be anywhere in the city - find and kill her. I beg of you.
71.context: NodeContext: hates how powerless she feels

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I won't be killing Ethel. In fact, I've made a deal with her.

1.speaker: Adrielle
1.text: I'll send your head back to your mistress, you wretched scum.
1.context: NodeContext: serious, determined - combat about to start

78.speaker: Adrielle
78.text: When next I pray, you shall be the first name on my lips. Thank you.

85.speaker: Adrielle
85.text: You must stop the hag, or she'll never stop tormenting us. Please.
85.context: NodeContext: hpleading - hates how powerless she feels

89.speaker: Adrielle
89.text: Damn that hag - damn her to the Nine Hells.
89.context: NodeContext: dissapointed in herself that she 'let' this happen

97.speaker: Adrielle
97.text: Forgive me for raising a hand against you. The dragonborn worked hard to stoke our paranoia - yet the fiend was working for the hag this whole time.
97.context: NodeContext: horrified that she attacked the player and that she missed the truth about the dragonborn

28.speaker: Adrielle
28.text: That means Ethel knows I'm here - and that I have it. Helm protect me - I'm dead.
28.context: NodeContext: hint of fear as this dawns on her, building up to the last line

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I won't let that happen, I promise.

43.speaker: Adrielle
43.text: You carry Helm's strength and assurance - He sent you to me, I know it.

77.speaker: Adrielle
77.text: I discovered Ethel's darkest secret - a way to burn that witch for good. No more tricks, no more comebacks.

18.speaker: Adrielle
18.text: It's in a safe in the back - within lies everything I know about hags. Use that knowledge to kill Ethel, and free this world of her evil - I beg of you.
18.context: NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

38.speaker: Adrielle
38.text: Ethel's darkest secret - a way to burn that witch for good. No more tricks, no more comebacks.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Tell me and I'll kill Ethel - I promise.

90.speaker: Adrielle
90.text: No, it cannot die with me! I discovered Ethel's darkest secret - a way to burn that witch for good. No more tricks, no more comebacks.

100.speaker: Adrielle
100.text: Jatlo took off like the fiends of the Nine Hells were on his tail...
